bibl.title: Letter from Henry Hanson to Henry Rose Carter, July 11, 1922

div1.p: Hanson requests that Carter critique his preliminary report on the yellow fever campaign in Peru. He asks if his resume describing his work in 1921 and 1922 has been received.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Hanson to Henry Rose Carter, July 11, 1922
div1.opener:
NUMERO
----
DIRECTOR GENERAL
HENRY HANSON
M. D.
BAJO LOS AUSPICIOS DEL
GOBIERNO PERUANO Y LA
JUNTA INTERNACIONAL DE
SANIDAD DE ROCKEFELLER
FOUNDATION
N. H. B
Peru Hanson
General Report
Campaña Sanitaria contra la Fiebre Amarilla en el Perú
OFICINA CENTRAL
AVENIDA PIEROLA 545 - TELEFONO 3428
LIMA - PERU
July 11, 1922.
My Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am sending you a copy of this thing which I
have called a General Report on Sanitary Conditions in Peru. If you
have time I wish you would read it and tell me whether it has any merit.
It has been written, or rather it was composed somewhat hurriedly as I
have had very little time to dedicate to reports up to date. I am hoping
that I shall have some time to devote to seeing whether I can get up
something in the line of a report after I get to the states. I am
taking some files and papers with me, but owing to the crowded state
of affairs and the lack of system in the Salubridad I am not certain
that I shall be able to take with me everything which would be of im-
portance or interest for the report.

Some time ago I sent you a copy of a resume which we have
gotten up on the work of the years 1921 and 1922, which I hope that
you have received.

We are leaving here on the Ebro on the 21st of this month and
should get to New York about the 3rd of August. We are leaving a little
earlier than we at first expected to do. Here is hoping that we shall
have ample opportunity to discuss the campaign on my arrival.
